snippet: Members of the House committee investigating the attacks that killed Ambassador J. Christopher Stevens accused one another of exploiting the violence to score partisan political points.
abstract: Members of the House committee investigating the attacks that killed Ambassador J Christopher Stevens in Libya accuse one another of exploiting the violence to score partisan political points and ignoring broader issues of intelligence warnings and security matters.

byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: Members of the House committee investigating the attacks that killed Ambassador J. Christopher Stevens accused one another of exploiting the violence to score partisan political points.

headline.seo: Before House Hearings on Libya Attack, Accusations of Playing Politics
headline.main: Before Hearings on Libya Attack, Charges of Playing Politics
headline.print_headline: Before Hearings on Libya Attack, Charges of Playing Politics

keywords.value: House Oversight and Government Reform Committee
